parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
A war, battle, strife. From pelomai; warfare.
Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.
A war, battle, strife. From pelomai; warfare.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To disturb, agitate; pass: To be troubled, alarmed. From threomai to wail; to clamor, i.e. to frighten.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Not yet. From ou and po; not yet.
